Little is left of the Wall at its original site, which was destroyed almost everywhere. Three long sections are still standing: an 80-metre (263 ft) piece of the first (westernmost) wall at the [[Topography of Terror]], site of the former [[Gestapo]] headquarters, half way between [[Checkpoint Charlie]] and [[Potsdamer Platz]]; a longer section of the second (easternmost) wall along the [[Spree]] River near the [[OberbaumbrÃ¼cke]], nicknamed [[East Side Gallery]]; and a third section that is partly reconstructed, in the north at [[Bernauer StraÃe]], which was turned into a memorial in 1999. Some other isolated fragments and a few watchtowers also remain in various parts of the city.
Little is left of the Wall at its original site, which was destroyed almost everywhere. Three long sections are still standing: an 80-metre (263 ft) piece of the first (westernmost) wall at the [[Topography of Terror]], site of the former [[Gestapo]] headquarters, half way between [[Checkpoint Charlie]] and [[Potsdamer Platz]]; a longer section of the second (easternmost) wall along the [[Spree]] River near the [[OberbaumbrÃ¼cke]], nicknamed [[East Side Gallery]]; and a third section that is partly reconstructed, in the north at [[Bernauer StraÃe]], which was turned into a memorial in 1999. Some other isolated fragments and a few watchtowers also remain in various parts of the city.
